p:
SOD catalyzes the dismutation of stress-generated
O 2 •–
in one of two less harmful species: either molecular oxygen (O 2) or hydrogen peroxide (H 2O 2). APX and CAT are the most important enzymes degrading H 2O 2 in plants. They transform H 2O 2 to H 2O and O 2. APX isoforms are primarily found in the cytosol and chloroplasts, while the CAT isoforms are found in peroxisomes. APX has strong affinity for H 2O 2 and uses ASC as an electron donor. In contrast, CAT removes H 2O 2 generated in the peroxisomal respiratory pathway without the need to reduce power. Even though CAT affinity for H 2O 2 is low, its elevated rate of reaction offers an effective way to detoxify H 2O 2 inside the cell. PRX may reduce both hydroperoxide and peroxynitrite.
